info.title: ENEDIS REST Client
info.description:
# Authorization
This authorization is materialized by an access token, also called a token, which must be presented by the application each time a catalog API is called. The authorization API allows you to retrieve an access token to the APIs in the catalog to which you have subscribed.
Enedis has chosen to implement the OAUTH 2.0 protocol to manage access to its APIs, more precisely through the Client Credentials Grant Flow scenario.

The version of this API (v3) corresponds to an alignment with the Oauth2 standard.

# Metering Data
This API makes it possible to recover the daily energy consumption for the delivery point of customers equipped with Linky communicating meters. Access to this resource is conditioned by the prior collection of client consent by Enedis.

## Additional Information
In the sandbox, use the URL : https://ext.hml.api.enedis.fr
In production, use the URL : https://ext.prod.api.enedis.fr

post.description: Allows you to revoke an authorization token.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Format of the request body

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
Client application identifier, in the form of Basic or digest authentication. 
 Basic authentication is base64_encoded(Client_ID:Client_secret).
 Is mandatory if the parameters client_id and client_secret are not passed.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Description of the equipment that issued the request (hardware/software)
parameters.example: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; U; Android 4.0.3; fr-fr; LG-L160L Build/IML74K)

token.description: Identifier of the token to delete in the case of a unitary deletion.

token_type_hint.description: Type of token to be deleted

client_id.description: Identifier of the client application for which you want to delete the token.

client_secret.description:
Secret identifier of the client application for which you want to delete the tokens.
This parameter is mandatory if the authentication is of the secret type and if the authentication is not done by basic authentication.

200.description: Effective token invalidation or non-existent token

400.description: Error in the format of the request

error.description: Error code returned by the system.

error_description.description: Description of the error corresponding to the code.
enum: The request is missing a required parameter, includes an unsupported parameter value (other than grant type), repeats a parameter, includes multiple credentials, utilizes more than one mechanism for authenticating the client, or is otherwise malformed
Client authentication failed (e.g., unknown client, no client authentication included, or unsupported authentication method)

The provided authorization grant (e.g. authorization code, resource owner credentials) or refresh token is invalid, expired, revoked, does not match the redirection URI used in the authorization request, or was issued to another client.
The requested scope is invalid, unknown, malformed, or exceeds the scope granted by the resource owner
The authenticated client is not authorized to use this authorization grant type
The authorization grant type is not supported by the authorization server
The authorization server does not support the revocation of the presented token type
empty header bad request format partial or incorrect data
Valid authentication credentials are mandatory to access the resource

500.description: Server Error - An error occurred while the server was processing the request

503.description: Service not available - The server is temporarily unavailable

post.description: Allows you to request the generation of a token using the Client Credential method.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Format of the request body

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
Client application identifier, in the form of Basic or digest authentication. 
 Basic authentication is base64_encoded(Client_ID:Client_secret).
 Is mandatory if the parameters client_id and client_secret are not passed.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Description of the equipment that issued the request (hardware/software)
parameters.example: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; U; Android 4.0.3; fr-fr; LG-L160L Build/IML74K)

grant_type.description: Defines the type of authorization used.

client_id.description:
Unique identifier of the application consuming the API.
Must be set if the Authorize header is not transmitted.

client_secret.description:
The secret of the application consuming the API, associated with the client_id.
  Must be set if the Authorize header is not transmitted.

access_token.description: The JWT access token generated to consume the APIs

token_type.description: Gives the type of token generated. It is a bearer token by default.

expires_in.description: The duration of the token before it expires (in seconds)

scope.description: Scope of the JWT access token generated to access the requested resource.

400.description: Error in the format of the request

error.description: Error code returned by the system.

error_description.description: Description of the error corresponding to the code.
enum: The request is missing a required parameter, includes an unsupported parameter value (other than grant type), repeats a parameter, includes multiple credentials, utilizes more than one mechanism for authenticating the client, or is otherwise malformed
Client authentication failed (e.g., unknown client, no client authentication included, or unsupported authentication method)

The provided authorization grant (e.g. authorization code, resource owner credentials) or refresh token is invalid, expired, revoked, does not match the redirection URI used in the authorization request, or was issued to another client
The requested scope is invalid, unknown, malformed, or exceeds the scope granted by the resource owner
The authenticated client is not authorized to use this authorization grant type
The authorization grant type is not supported by the authorization server

500.description: Server Error - An error occurred while the server was processing the request

503.description: Service not available - The server is temporarily unavailable

get.description:
Allows to retrieve the daily energy consumption of the requested period **[start;end[** in **Wh** for the delivery point and the authenticated holder, or whose identifier is given in parameter.
Each value is dated.
A call can be made for data dating back a maximum of 36 months and 15 days before the call date.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Oauth token delivered to the client application.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Acceptable response format

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Fomat of the request body (application/json or application/xml)

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Description of the equipment that issued the request (hardware/software)

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the person (natural or legal) holding the metering point.

parameters.name: usage_point_id
parameters.description: Metering Point ID from which the data is to be collected

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start date of the requested range in the full-date format of RFC 3339, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End date of the requested range in the full-date format of RFC 3339 format, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD

usage_point_id.description: Metering Point ID from which the data is to be collected

start.description:
Start date of the returned range
Format YYYY-MM-DD

end.description:
End date of the returned range
Format YYYY-MM-DD

quality.description: Quality of the data, raw (BRUT) or corrected

measurement_kind.description: Type of measurement requested. Possible values : none, energy, power, voltage.In this case : energy

aggregate.description: Corresponds to the type of business size consulted. Possible values : none, average, maximum and sum. For this size : sum

400.description: Error in the format of the request

error.description: Error code returned by the system.

error_description.description: Description of the error corresponding to the code.
enum: Empty header, bad request format, partial or incorrect data
usage_point_id parameter must be 14 digits long
Start date parameter must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD
End date parameter must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD
The end date parameter must be earlier than the current date
Start date should be before end date
The requested period cannot be anterior to the meter's last activation date
The start date must be greater than the history deadline
The seeker is not recognized as the actual meter holder
person_id parameter is required when the user is not an authentified customer

error.description: Error code returned by the system.

error_description.description: Description of the error corresponding to the code.
error_description.example: user is not authorized to access this resource
enum: No consent can be found for this customer and this usage point.
user is not authorized to access this resource

error.description: Error code returned by the system.

error_description.description: Description of the error corresponding to the code.
error_description.example: no measure found for this usage point

get.summary: Recovery of the load curve on withdrawal
get.description: Allows the retrieval of the extraction load curve over the interval [start;end[ for the delivery point entered and the holder authenticated, or whose identifier is given in the parameter. The depth of data available in one call is one week. The returned values are average consumption powers in W over the meter measurement interval (by default 30m), each value is time-stamped. The load curve is obtained on full days from midnight to midnight of the following day in local time. A call can be made on data dating back a maximum of 24 months and 15 days before the call date.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Oauth token issued to the client application.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Acceptable response format

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Fomat of the request body (application/json or application/xml)

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Description of the equipment that issued the request (hardware/software)

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the person (natural or legal) holding the point.

parameters.name: usage_point_id
parameters.description: Delivery Point Identifier (DPI)

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start date of the requested range in RFC full-date format 3339, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End date of the requested range in RFC full-date format 3339, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD

start.description:
Start date of the returned range
Format YYYY-MM-DD

end.description:
End date of the returned range
Format YYYY-MM-DD

quality.description: Quality of the data, raw (BRUT) or corrected

measurement_kind.description:
Type of measurement requested. Possible values: none, energy, power, voltage.
For this case: power.

aggregate.description:
Corresponds to the type of business size consulted.
Possible values: none, average, maximum and sum.
For this quantity: average'.

interval_length.description: PT5M: 5 minute steps, PT10M: 10 minute steps, PT15M: 15 minute steps, PT30M: 30 minute steps, PT60M: 60 minute step

measure_type.description: Qualifies the type of measurement (B = BRUT)

error.description: Error code returned by the system.

error_description.description: Description of the error corresponding to the code.
enum: Empty header, bad request format, partial or incorrect data
usage_point_id parameter must be 14 digits long
Start date parameter must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD
End date parameter must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD
The end date parameter must be earlier than the current date
Start date should be before end date
The requested period cannot be anterior to the meter's last activation date
The start date must be greater than the history deadline
The requested period must be less than 7 days for an access to the load curve
The seeker is not recognized as the actual meter holder
The customer objected to the load curve recording
person_id parameter is required when the user is not an authentified customer

error.description: Error code returned by the system.

error_description.description: Description of the error corresponding to the code.
error_description.example: user is not authorized to access this resource
enum: No consent can be found for this customer and this usage point.
user is not authorized to access this resource

error.description: Error code returned by the system.

error_description.description: Description of the error corresponding to the code.
error_description.example: no measure found for this usage point
